fr.michaelm.jump.plugin.topology
Class LinearComponent

java.lang.Object
  fr.michaelm.jump.plugin.topology.LinearComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Comparable
public class LinearComponent
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable

Linear component of a Feature Geometry. A LinearComponent holds a reference to the Feature it comes from, the index of the component in the Geometry and the index of the LineString in the Component.

  • Simple geometries always have their compIndex = 0
  • Non polygonal geometries always have their lineIndex = 0
A linearComponent also contains a list of Nodes and useful methods to insert these Nodes in the geometry or to split the geometry on these Nodes.

Constructor Detail

LinearComponent

public LinearComponent(com.vividsolutions.jump.feature.Feature feature,
                       int compIndex,
                       int lineIndex)
Creates a new LinearComponent from a Feature, and two indexes locating the component in the Geometry.

Parameters:
feature - the feature this component belongs to
compIndex - index of the component in the Geometry for GeometryCollection (0 for simple geometries)
lineIndex - index of the LineString or LinearRing in the component (0 for the exterior ring of a Polygon, a LineString or a Point)

addNode

public void addNode(Node node)
Add a Node to this LinearComponent.

insertNodes

public void insertNodes()
Insert Nodes contained in this LinearComponent nodes list in this LinearComponent feature Geometry. The nodes list is cleared after this operation, because indexes of the Nodes are no more valid.

getSegmentIterator

public java.util.Iterator<com.vividsolutions.jts.geom.LineSegment> getSegmentIterator()
Return an Iterator iterating through the LineSegment of this LinearComponent.

splitAtNodes

public void splitAtNodes()
Split this LinearComponent at each Node and update its Feature Geometry. The Nodes are removed from the list fter they have been used.

compareTo

public int compareTo(java.lang.Object o)
LinearComponent can be compared to another LinearComponent for sorting. The comparatot compares successively :
  • the Feature ID
  • the component Index in the Geometry
  • the LineString index in the component

Specified by:
compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable
